summary: Armor, Boots, Gauntlets, and Helm in two styles: Mithril and Black Mithril.
descriptionHtml:
Edhildils Mithril Armors
Author: Edhildil
6,3,2013
ver 1.1
 
IF THIS MOD IS NOT FOR YOU PLEASE SKIP IT.


Please read all of the description before you post a comment.

[img]http://img832.imageshack.us/img832/1236/descriptionn.png[/img]


This is a female standalone Armor mod, I made it from scratch and Calientes CBBE body.

The lowerbody has been enhanced in the derrier region (buttock)
for a fuller, rounder profile. The waist is somewhat thinner.

Armor, Boots, Gauntlets, and Helm in two styles: Mithril and Black Mithril.

Craftable under Elvish catagory. 

I only made one size as the armor was made from my tailored body shape. 
If someone wants to make it for another body type, Bodyslide or BBP, go for it.
I\'m not going to remake this.

Bodyslide and BBP conversion of this armor is now available as part of Bodyslide CB Plus Plus. Download the \"CB Plus Plus 6 - Various\" package. The main package is required as well.
It is here (version 1):     http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/32731

[img]http://img84.imageshack.us/img84/3664/updatesb.png[/img]

version 1.2

I have now added: Blue, Grey(original black version), Green, Purple, Red, and Yellow Mithril craftable sets.

Like previous versions, I also added tempering to the armors, but I haven\'t tried to temper any of them, the effect as yet is 

unknown to me. 

because the Shader properties are different, and the textures are shared, the meshes need to be different = Bigger file size.

So.. that makes me think that if Caliente can make a mod that rewrites meshes there must be a way somehow to make a slider for 

specular intensity and the actual color spectrum, in which case, the file would be much smaller. Until then or if then, this 

mod uses the Oblivion approach by using a separate file for each different color scheme. And yes, I just proposed an 

interesting idea that is outside my modding ability: Sliders for color and intensity values for Specular,emissive,lighting 

effects,environment map scaling, etc. Or i\'m a science fiction writer on glue. for now, separate meshes is how i\'m going to do 

it. In other words, these aren\'t texture swaps, they\'re Shader Properties that are unique for each color and mesh. 

FOR MODDERS:   *(others please skip to \"other notes\" below, it\'s a bunch of tech mumbo-jumbo and very caddywhompas)

That being said, just copy/paste the BSLightingShaderProperty of each color for BBP modders, don\'t convert 8000 identical 

nifs.Nifskope users can customize the colors by altering the Specular Color property by clicking on the rainbow icon to the 

right of the Specular Color in the Block Details of the BSLightingShaderProperty. Emissive colors can be altered to, as well 

as the Specular Strenth (0=none, 999=maximum). Not to mention the Environment Map Scale, which does something, I think, to the 

Environment Map (I think this is the chrome reflection; in oblivion I always saw trees reflected in my chrome stuff).

Make a back-up Nif in case you biff it/have a blow out/wreck your mesh; or simply memorize what you tweaked and set the value 

back to where it was at or lessen/ increase to taste. If you melt your monitor screen it\'s not my fault or turn it back down.

*Other notes:

Not tested with ENB as far as how it looks, this may increase/decrease glare depending on your ENB preferences.

The color effect seems less while out in the daylight, while indoors and during night by light sources seems to increase the 

effect (Grey Mithril and Mithril armors not so much).

This means that the color of the screenshots are at full effect. Ever lose your companion in dim light?

First I\'d like to thank ChronoTrigger77, Xanshio, and madpaddy for their great observations and advice. After I 
thought about the Black Mithril texture it did look like PVC plastic. These are the type of comments/discussions
that help modders constructively. I forgot to update the Tangent Spaces so now the detail should be much better.

I have changed the Black Mithril texture to something truly awesome in my opinion. I added a black specular property
at a value of 500.00. Slightly darker than the Mithril Armor, but it now looks like metal and its shiny. This value can be reduced or increased in Nifskope (0=none, 999=total), its in the Shader block details. Check the screenies.

The textures are the same for both sets, but the Shader Properties are different.

For those who like the grey texture I will leave that up as an optional file.

Please post pictures! I like pictures.

[img]http://img651.imageshack.us/img651/4153/requir.png[/img]


Latest Skyrim 1.9

Calientes Big Bottem Edition v 3.2 -You\'ll need this for all the body textures and hand, feet, face/head meshes, etc.
 
[img]http://img827.imageshack.us/img827/2482/installa.png[/img]


1)Unzip the file to a temporary folder and read the contents.


unzip and copy/paste the data folder into your \"skyrim\" folder
(without the quotes). Activate the .esp 


uninstall:

delete included files and esp

[img]http://img194.imageshack.us/img194/9223/bugske.png[/img]


Even though I thought I got the Skyrim supported version of NifSkope,
it will not show me the dismemberment vertices,(AARGH!)so I may have the 
dismemberments off, I will fix this when I can figure out the dismemberment vertices.
This armor seems unaffected during testing so far. This means that some combinations of gloves and/or boots may behave weird.
